item.title: Reference: Signing Commits with GPG
item.description: Creating a GPG Key Create a key with gpg --gen-key and input your name, email address, and passphrase when prompted. For more options, use gpg --full-generate-key. To view secret keys: gpg --list-secret-keys or gpg -K To export secret keys: gpg --export-secret-keys $ID > private-key.asc To export public key for sharing: gpg --armor --export $ID > public-key.asc or gpg --armor --export $EMAIL > public-key.asc Using the GPG Key with Git In your git repo:
